alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Macon; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 5:31PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Bullock, southern Macon and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 615 PM CST... At 531 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Shorter to near Grady. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tuskegee, Meadville, Pine Level, Liverpool, Dublin, Franklin Field, Lake Tuskegee, Hardaway, Shopton, Grady, Davisville, Lapine, High Ridge, Fort Davis, Cross Keys, Mitchell, Currys and Simsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for south central and southeastern Alabama.
